label: lem-qsd-lower-bound
name: QSD Density Has Uniform Lower Bound

parameters_detailed.sigma_x: Position jitter scale parameter for cloning Gaussian perturbations
parameters_detailed.R: Radius of valid domain B_R (compact ball)
parameters_detailed.B_R: Valid domain (compact ball of radius R)
parameters_detailed.c_pi: Explicit uniform lower bound constant = c_sigma_x_R * m_eq

cross_chapter_dependencies.description: φ-irreducibility via kinetic exploration + cloning teleportation, and existence/uniqueness of QSD
Gaussian position jitter with variance sigma_x^2 in cloning
Cloning position update x'_i = x_j + sigma_x * zeta_i^x where zeta ~ N(0, I_d)

proof_structure.strategy: Combine φ-irreducibility + Gaussian accessibility + invariant measure theory + mollification
steps: Step 1: φ-Irreducibility - Euclidean Gas can reach any neighborhood from any state (thm-phi-irreducibility)
Step 2: Gaussian Accessibility - Cloning with Gaussian jitter provides global teleportation
Step 3: Support of Invariant Measure - Irreducible process has QSD with full support on B_R
Step 4: Smooth Density Implies Positive Infimum - C^∞ function on compact set with full support is strictly positive
Step 5: Explicit Lower Bound via Gaussian Mollification - Apply lem-gaussian-lower-bound to get c_pi

key_mechanisms.phi_irreducibility: From thm-phi-irreducibility in 06_convergence (two-stage construction: kinetic + cloning)
key_mechanisms.gaussian_teleportation: Cloning with sigma_x > 0 allows jumps to any neighborhood
key_mechanisms.gaussian_mollification: From lem-gaussian-lower-bound: convolution with Gaussian kernel

mathematical_foundation.irreducibility_theory: Meyn & Tweedie 2009, Markov Chains and Stochastic Stability, Theorem 4.2.2
mathematical_foundation.invariant_measure_support: Invariant measure of irreducible process has full support on accessible state space

result.uniform_lower_bound: pi_QSD(x) ≥ c_pi > 0 for all x ∈ B_R
result.dependence: c_pi depends on cloning jitter scale sigma_x and equilibrium mass m_eq

physical_interpretation: Gaussian jitter in cloning ensures QSD has strictly positive density everywhere in valid domain. Smaller sigma_x gives tighter lower bound. This prevents density ratio from diverging.
usage_in_chapter: Critical for proving bounded density ratio assumption (ax-uniform-density-bound-hk) needed for Hellinger contraction (Lemma C)
